page.title: 07WRECK REMAINS
page.content: Wreck remains Blackhead. There are two wrecks in living memory. The PINDOS was wrecked on Chynhalls Point at 9pm on 1st Februart 1912 after taking a cargo of nitrates from Chile to Falmouth.She was a steel masted barque of 2354 tons.The crew were saved by the Coverack lifeboat the Constance Melanie. The GUNVOR a 3 masted steel barque of 1491 tons ran onto Pedn Boar near Blackhead on 6 April 1912 loaded with nitrates under full sail.She was so close to the cliffs that the bowsprit overhung the rocks and the crew lowered a rope ladder to get off. Two fishermen from Coverack,crabbing in the fog came upon the empty ship with all sail set rammed on the cliff. Items may still come ashore.
